Koji Kumakura (Senior) | designer = [[Hyung-tae Kim]] (character) | programmer = Kwang-sub Shin (Lead)
Jack Porter (Engine)
Chaitanya Munjuluri (Engine)
Go-eun Kim (Engine)
Ji-ho Lee (Battle) | artist = Hyung-tae Kim | writer = Tily | composer = Sung-woon Jang | engine = [[Unreal Engine 3]]{{cite web|url=http://www.magnacarta.jp/gamedata/index.html |title=マグナカルタ2 | バンダイナムコゲームス公式サイト |publisher=Magnacarta.jp |date= |accessdate=2013-10-03}}{{cite web|url=https://www.unrealengine.com/showcase/magnacarta-2 |title=Softmax and Namco Bandai Build Fantasy RPG Magnacarta 2 with Unreal Engine 3 |publisher=Unrealengine.com |date= |accessdate=2014-06-18}} | released = {{vgrelease|JP|August 6, 2009{{cite web|url=http://www.famitsu.com/game/news/1223622_1124.html|title=''Magna Carta 2'', major RPG by Korean makers, trailer revealed|language=Japanese|date=2009-04-21|accessdate=2009-04-21}}|NA|October 13, 2009{{cite web| author=Spencer | date=July 24, 2009 | title=Magnacarta 2 Liberated This October | url=http://www.siliconera.com/2009/07/24/magnacarta-2-liberated-this-october/ | work=Siliconera.com | accessdate=2009-07-24}}|EU|October 16, 2009{{cite web| title=Magna Carta 2 (Xbox 360) | url=https://www.amazon.co.uk/Magna-Carta-2-Xbox-360/dp/B002FL4R5G}}}} | genre = [[Role-playing video game]] | modes = [[Single-player]] | platforms = [[Xbox 360]] }} '''''MagnaCarta 2''''' (마그나카르타 2 ''Mageunakareuta 2'', マグナカルタ2 ''Magunakaruta 2'') is a [[video game]] developed by South Korean developer [[Softmax (game developer)|Softmax]] and published by [[Namco Bandai Games]] exclusively for [[Xbox 360]]. It is a follow-up to the [[role-playing video game]]s ''[[Magna Carta: The Phantom of Avalanche]]'' released on [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] and ''[[Magna Carta: Crimson Stigmata]]'' released on the [[PlayStation 2]]. It was released in Japan on August 6, 2009 and in North America on October 13, 2009. This marks the series' first entry onto a [[History of video game consoles (seventh generation)|seventh generation console]]. The game was officially unveiled in the April 2009 edition of ''[[Famitsu]]'' magazine.{{cite web| title= Magna Carta II revealed in latest Famitsu| publisher=Scrawlfx | url=http://scrawlfx.com/2009/04/magna-carta-ii-revealed-in-latest-famitsu| date=| accessdate=2009-04-18}} {{TOC limit|3}} ==Gameplay== [[File:MagnaCarta 2 - Gameplay.jpg|left|thumb|275px|A battle late in the game, with Argo, Zephie, and Rue in play against Northern Forces soldiers. Here, the player is controlling Argo.]] In ''MagnaCarta 2'', the player controls their characters from a third-person perspective, usually in one of two "Modes". In Movement Mode, the player explores the area, talks with other characters and interacts with the environment. In Combat Mode, the player character enters a battle stance, which lets them fight enemies at the cost of slower movement speed.{{cite web|url=http://www.magnacarta.kr/Systems/SysWar.aspx |title=Magnacarta2 system|work=마그나카르타2 XBOX |publisher=Magnacarta.kr|language=Korean |date= |accessdate=2013-11-24}} The game's battle system combines strategic turn-based and real-time elements and battles directly occur in the field, with no loading screens. Up to three active members can be in the field at any one time, with the remaining three members waiting to be switched in. The player can choose between using normal attacks or moves that use Kan, a type of energy. These Kan moves generate or use Kan. If all three active members' [[health (gaming)|hit points]] reach zero, [[Game over|the game is over]] and the player restarts from their last save point. As the player presses the attack button, their character's "Overdrive" gauge will fill up. Once full, the character will enter an "Overdrive" state, where their attack power is increased. However, once the player can no longer attack, their character will fall into an "Overheat" state, rendering them unable to attack until the gauge lowers enough for them to attack again. Players can use this gauge to their advantage by using "Chain Drives"—the process of Overdriving one character into Overheat, immediately switching to another character already present, then Overdriving them as well. This frees both members' Overdrive gauges, enabling both to attack without hindrance. Players can also use Solo and Co-op Techniques, which unleash devastating combination attacks on their target. The player collects Kamonds to power-up weapons via their accompanying "Kamond Board". Kamonds are also used to strengthen characters and craft new items. Kamonds are usually obtained by defeating monsters or Sentinels, but can also be found in treasure chests or as rewards for finishing quests. At Kamond Shops, players can craft to turn Kamonds into new accessories. Recipes and money are needed to craft with Kamonds. Recipes are earned as rewards for completing certain quests.{{cite web|url=http://www.magnacarta.kr/Systems/SysField.aspx |title=Magnacarta2 system|work=마그나카르타2 XBOX |publisher=Magnacarta.kr|language=Korean |date= |accessdate=2013-11-24}}{{cite web|title=Magnacarta 2 Goes Gold: New Screenshots |url=http://news.teamxbox.com/xbox/21096/Magnacarta-2-Goes-Gold-New-Screenshots/ |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091005025952/http://news.teamxbox.com/xbox/21096/Magnacarta-2-Goes-Gold-New-Screenshots |archivedate=October 5, 2009 }} ==Story== [[File:MagnaCarta 2 - Main Cast.jpg|240px|thumbnail|left|The main cast of ''MagnaCarta 2''. Top row: Juto (left), Zephie, and Argo. Bottom row: Crocell, Celestine, and Rue.]] ''MagnaCarta 2'' is set in the fictional kingdom of Lanzheim, divided by an ongoing civil war between the Northern Forces, led by the usurper Shuenzeit Baron; and the Southern Forces, led by Rzephilda "Zephie" Berlinette, the Princess of Lanzheim. In response to the Northern Forces' "Sentinels"—destructive, living weapons based on the extinct Carta race—Zephie forms the Counter-Sentinel Unit in order to turn the tide. However, while trying to find the Sentinels' weakness, Zephie's bodyguard Rue is captured by the Northern Forces. Zephie goes to rescue her friend: however, as they make their escape, they are intercepted by Schuenzeit's best soldier, Elgar the Regicide. Zephie takes Elgar's killing blow to Rue and despite what should have been a mortal wound, drives Elgar away.{{cite video game|title=MagnaCarta 2|developer=[[Softmax (game developer)|Softmax]]|publisher=[[Banpresto]], [[Namco Bandai Games]], [[Atari]]|date=6 August – 16 October 2009|platform=[[Xbox 360]]|version=|scene=Prologue|level=|quote='''Narrator''': It was January, in the year 1149 of the Lanzheim calendar. ''[…]'' Schuenzeit, Prime Minister of Lanzheim, staged a rebellion, killing Queen Ibrin and usurping the throne. ''[…]'' Princess Rzephillda, who was 15 years old, had been held prisoner within the palace for a time, but made a miraculous escape and in order to resist Schuenzeit, elisted the help of Count Alex, an influential noble. ''[…]'' One year later[.] The Northern Forces, [consisting] of Lanzheim army troops and led by Schuenzeit, clashed with the Southern Forces, formed by Count Alex and the lords of neighboring cities. This was the beginning of what would later be called the Lanzheim Civil War.}} Two years later, on Highwind Island, an ancient weapon similar to the Sentinels is discovered in the island's ancient ruins. Because of this, Juto—a young [[amnesiac]] with a [[hoplophobia|fear of swords]]{{cite video game|title=MagnaCarta 2|developer=[[Softmax (game developer)|Softmax]]|publisher=[[Banpresto]], [[Namco Bandai Games]], [[Atari]]|date=6 August – 16 October 2009|platform=[[Xbox 360]]|version=|scene=Flashback|level=Highwind Island|quote='''Juto''': I knew it… I can't do it. I can't pick up a real sword no matter how hard I try… Why…? / '''Melissa''': You know, you might not remember it, but I bet you've fought in a war. I bet it must've been terrifying, to see so many people dying. Maybe that's why you're scared of real swords, things that hurt people. ''[…]'' If real swords are no good, then let's start with a wooden sword.}}—soon encounters Zephie and Argo, who came to investigate the weapon for the Southern Forces.{{cite video game|title=MagnaCarta 2|developer=[[Softmax (game developer)|Softmax]]|publisher=[[Banpresto]], [[Namco Bandai Games]], [[Atari]]|date=6 August – 16 October 2009|platform=[[Xbox 360]]|version=|scene=|level=Highwind Island - Village|quote='''Village Chief''': Wh-What is the meaning of this? Northern Forces are in the Windsong Caverns?! / '''Zephie''': They seem to be after the Guardian. ''[…]'' Please don't worry. We will set out for the caverns at once. But to do so, we will need someone to come along and guide us there. / '''Juto''': I'll go! / '''Village Chief''': Juto? But wait, you're… / '''Juto''': A while ago, Melissa said she was going to the caverns. I want to see if she's safe.}} Learning that Northern Forces soldiers have arrived in the ruins and remembering that his adoptive sister, Melissa, had gone there earlier, Juto volunteers to guide the Counter-Sentinel Unit members to the ruins.{{cite video game|title=MagnaCarta 2|developer=[[Softmax (game developer)|Softmax]]|publisher=[[Banpresto]], [[Namco Bandai Games]], [[Atari]]|date=6 August – 16 October 2009|platform=[[Xbox 360]]|version=|scene=|level=Highwind Island - Windsong Caverns|quote='''Southern Soldier''': Northern Forces soldiers went into the caverns in search of the Guardian. Our troops gave chase to them, along with the head of the Island Guards. / '''Juto''': With Melissa?!}} Upon arrival, they find that the Northern Forces have activated the weapon. When the weapon injures Melissa, Juto single-handedly destroys the weapon in a [[berserker]] rage.{{cite video game|title=MagnaCarta 2|developer=[[Softmax (game developer)|Softmax]]|publisher=[[Banpresto]], [[Namco Bandai Games]], [[Atari]]|date=6 August – 16 October 2009|platform=[[Xbox 360]]|version=|scene=|level=Highwind Island - Village|quote='''Melissa''': Juto, you were out cold for three whole days. We were all worried about you. ''[…]'' / '''Juto''': Melissa, you saw it too, didn't you? You saw me defeat the Guardian. I beat it, and I didn't even have a proper weapon. I beat that monster… But what happened to me in there? All that power… It's like… It's like ''I'm'' the one who's the real monster. / '''Melissa''': But Juto, if you hadn't been there, we all might have been killed.}} ==Development== After developing ''[[Magna Carta: Tears of Blood]]'', a team of 40 at [[Softmax (game developer)|Softmax]] partnered with [[Namco Bandai]] to create MagnaCarta 2 for the Xbox 360, using the Unreal Engine 3.{{cite web|title=Softmax and Namco Bandai Build Fantasy RPG Magnacarta 2 with Unreal Engine 3|url=https://www.unrealengine.com/showcase/magnacarta-2|website=unrealengine.com|publisher=[[Epic Games]]|accessdate=8 October 2014|date=13 October 2009}} Development of ''MagnaCarta 2'' began between 2004 and 2005, taking over 4 years to finish.{{cite web|title=Magna Carta 2 development taking over 4 years|url=http://www.oxmonline.com/10079/magna-carta-2-development-taking-over-4-years/|website=oxmonline.com|accessdate=9 October 2014|date=3 May 2009}}{{cite web|author1=Spencer|title=What Took Magnacarta 2 So Long To Develop?|url=http://www.siliconera.com/2009/04/30/what-took-magnacarta-2-so-long-to-develop/|website=Siliconera|accessdate=9 October 2014|date=30 April 2009}} {{cite web|title=マグナカルタ2 {{!}} バンダイナムコゲームス公式サイト|url=http://www.magnacarta.jp/creators/index.html|work=|publisher=|accessdate=17 February 2013|language=Japanese}}{{cite web|title=マグナカルタ2 Lanzheim1152{{!}} ファミ通コミッククリア|url=http://www.famitsu.com/comic_clear/se_magna2/|work=[[Famitsu]].com|publisher=[[Famitsu]]|accessdate=17 February 2013|language=Japanese}}{{cite web|title=Magnacarta 2 Producer Shares Character Details And Explains Platform Choice|url=http://www.siliconera.com/2009/07/30/magnacarta-2-producer-shares-character-details-and-explains-platform-choice/|work=[[Siliconera]]|publisher=Siliconera|accessdate=18 February 2013|author=Spencer|date=30 July 2009}}{{cite web|last=Clements|first=Ryan|title=G-Star 2009: Tea With Hyung Tae Kim|url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2009/11/28/g-star-2009-tea-with-hyung-tae-kim|work=[[IGN]]|publisher=IGN|date=27 November 2009}}{{cite web|title=Magna Carta 2 - Developer Walkthrough|url=http://www.ign.com/videos/2009/10/08/magnacarta-2-xbox-360-video-developer-walkthrough|work=[[IGN]].com|publisher=IGN|accessdate=18 February 2013|date=8 October 2009}} {{cite web|title=Magnacarta 2 Now Available Exclusively for Xbox 360|url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2009/10/13/magnacarta-2-now-available-exclusively-for-xbox-360|work=[[IGN]]|publisher=IGN|accessdate=21 February 2013|author=IGN Staff|date=13 October 2009}} ==Reception== {{expand section|date=December 2011}} {{Video game reviews | state = | align = | GR = 70.19%{{cite web|title=Magna Carta 2 for Xbox 360|url=http://www.gamerankings.com/xbox360/930253-magna-carta-2/index.html|work=[[GameRankings]]|accessdate=14 February 2013}}{{cite web|title=Magna Carta 2 Reviews and Articles for Xbox 360|url=http://www.gamerankings.com/xbox360/930253-magnacarta-ii/articles.html|work=[[GameRankings]]|accessdate=14 February 2013}} | MC = 69/100 from 49 critics
7.1/10 from 44 user ratings | 1UP = C-{{cite web|last=Fitch|first=Andrew|title=Magna Carta 2 Review|url=http://www.1up.com/reviews/magna-carta-2-review|work=[[1UP.com|1UP]].com|publisher=[[1UP.com|1UP]]|accessdate=17 February 2013|date=10 November 2009}} | G4 = {{cite web|title=MagnaCarta 2 Review for Xbox 360|url=http://www.g4tv.com/games/xbox-360/34009/magnacarta-2/review/|work=G4tv|publisher=[[G4 Media]]|accessdate=21 February 2013}} | GI = 8.25/10{{cite web|last=Gonzalez|first=Annette|title=Slow Story And A Fast-Paced, Addictive Battle System - Magnacarta 2 - Xbox 360|url=http://www.gameinformer.com/games/magnacarta_2/b/xbox360/archive/2009/10/13/review.aspx|work=www.GameInformer.com|publisher=GameInformer|accessdate=14 February 2013|date=13 October 2009}} | GSpot = 6/10 | GT = 7.1/10{{cite web|title=Magnacarta 2|url=http://www.gametrailers.com/games/s7yvdq/magnacarta-2|work=[[GameTrailers]].com|publisher=[[GameTrailers]]|accessdate=17 February 2013}} | IGN = 6.8/10 | OXM = 7{{cite web|author1=OXM Staff|title=Magna Carta 2|url=http://www.oxmonline.com/14508/reviews/magna-carta-2-review/|website=oxmonline.com|accessdate=9 October 2014|date=16 October 2009}} | rev1 = ''Just Push Start'' | rev1Score = 8/10{{cite web|last=Fajardo|first=Mark|title=MagnaCarta 2 Review|url=http://www.justpushstart.com/2009/10/magnacarta-2-review/|work=Just Push Start|accessdate=14 February 2013|date=15 October 2009}} | rev2 = RPGamer | rev2Score = 4.5/5{{cite web|last1=Tidwell|first1=Mikel|title=MagnaCarta 2 - Staff Review|url=http://www.rpgamer.com/games/magna/magnacarta2/reviews/magnacarta2strev1.html|website=rpgamer.com|accessdate=9 October 2014}} }} The game received generally mixed reviews from critics, earning an aggregate [[Metacritic]] score of 69.{{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/xbox-360/magna-carta-2|title=Magna Carta 2 for Xbox 360|work=[[Metacritic]]|accessdate=9 February 2013}} [[IGN]] criticized the battle system stating, "this feels almost archaic and could have been run on a PS1, enemy AI is almost non-existent and character abilities are generic."{{cite web|last=Brudvig|first=Erik|url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2009/10/13/magnacarta-2-review|title=Magnacarta 2 Review|work=[[IGN]]|publisher=IGN|date=13 October 2009|accessdate=9 February 2013}} Robert Townslend of ''[[Game Informer]]'' said, "While the story starts off having the potential to be great, it quickly degrades into the same old story of a young man with no memories saving a kingdom. This has only been done thousands of times in other games."{{Citation needed|date=July 2012}} Annette Gonzalez of ''[[Game Informer]]'' was more positive, citing that the "[b]attles are intuitive and addicting, although awkward camera angles can sometimes hinder combat"; and praising the voice cast, saying the fully voiced dialogue is a "vast improvement over ''Tears of Blood''."{{cite web|url=http://www.gamespot.com/magna-carta-2/reviews/magna-carta-2-review-6238636/|title=Magna Carta 2 Review|last=Stella|first=Shiva|date=2 November 2009|work=[[GameSpot]]|publisher=[[GameSpot]]|accessdate=9 February 2013}}{{cite web|last=Miller|first=Matt|title=Complex Group Battle Mechanics Shine In Magnacarta 2|url=http://www.gameinformer.com/games/magnacarta_2/b/xbox360/archive/2009/09/29/preview.aspx|work=GameInformer.com|publisher=[[Game Informer]]|accessdate=14 February 2013|date=29 September 2009}}{{cite web|last=McWhertor|first=Michael|title=More Magna Carta II Artwork Means More Anatomical Artistic License|url=http://kotaku.com/5252395/more-magna-carta-ii-artwork-means-more-anatomical-artistic-license|work=[[Kotaku]].com|publisher=Kotaku|accessdate=17 February 2013|date=13 May 2009}} revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Joana Cipriano | image = <!-- just the filename, without the File: or Image: prefix or enclosing [[brackets]] --> | alt = | caption = | birth_name = Joana Isabel Cipriano | birth_date = {{birth date|df=yes|1996|5|31}} | birth_place = | death_date = <!-- {{Death date and age|YYYY|MM|DD|YYYY|MM|DD}} or {{Death-date and age|death date|birth date}} --> | death_place = | nationality = Portuguese | parents = Leonor Cipriano (mother) | disappeared_date = {{Disappeared date and age|df=yes|2004|9|12|1996|5|31}} | disappeared_place = [[Figueira (Faro)|Figueira]], Portugal | disappeared_status = Not Found | module = {{Infobox|child=yes | label1 = Investigating force | data1 = ''[[Polícia Judiciária]]'', [[Portimão]] | label2 = Charge | data2 = Murder | label3 = Convicted | data3 = Leonor Cipriano (mother), João Cipriano (maternal uncle)}} }} '''Joana Isabel Cipriano''' (born 31 May 1996) disappeared on 12 September 2004 from [[Figueira (Faro)|Figueira]], a village near [[Portimão]] in the [[Algarve]] region of [[Portugal]]. An investigation by the ''[[Polícia Judiciária]]'', Portugal's criminal police, concluded that she had been murdered by her mother, Leonor Cipriano, and her uncle, João Cipriano, after witnessing them engaged in [[incest]]uous sex. Her body was never found.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Hamilos |first1=Paul |last2=de Beer |first2=Brendan |date=3 October 2007 |title=Detective leading hunt for Madeleine sacked after blast at UK police |url=https://www.theguardian.com/uk/2007/oct/03/ukcrime.uknews4 |work=[[The Guardian]] |location=London |access-date=14 October 2017}}</ref>
The mother and uncle [[confession|confessed]] to police in October 2004; the uncle said he had cut the girl's body into pieces before disposing of it somewhere in [[Spain]].<ref name=PortugalNews>{{cite news |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |title=Prosecution unveils horror of girl’s death |url=http://www.theportugalnews.com/news/view/805-48 |work=The Portugal News |location= |date=14 May 2005 |access-date=14 October 2017}}</ref> Joana's mother withdrew her confession the day after signing it, alleging that she had been beaten during a 48-hour-long interrogation. The police officers accounted for the bruising on the mother's face and body by maintaining that she had thrown herself down some stairs in the police station in an effort to commit suicide. Both the mother and uncle were convicted of murder and sentenced to sixteen years in jail.<ref name=Govan26May2007/> It was the first murder trial in Portuguese legal history to take place [[murder conviction without a body|without the discovery of a body]].<ref name=Watts12May2008>{{cite news |last1=Watts |first1=Alex |date=12 May 2008 |title='Disturbing Similarities' With Madeleine |url=http://news.sky.com/story/603144/disturbing-similarities-with-madeleine |dead-url=y |language=English |work=[[Sky News]] |location=London |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303234140/http://news.sky.com/story/603144/disturbing-similarities-with-madeleine |archive-date=3 March 2016 |access-date=October 14, 2017 |via=[[Internet Archive]] [[Wayback Machine]]}}</ref>
Five officers were charged with a variety of offences as a result of the allegations of assault; three were [[acquittal|acquitted]].<ref name=charges>{{cite news |last=Govan |first=Fiona |date=28 May 2007 |title=The detectives working as the world watches |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/1552718/The-detectives-working-as-the-world-watches.html |work=[[The Daily Telegraph]] |location=London |access-date=14 October 2017}} *{{cite news |last=Gammell |first=Caroline |date=17 September 2007 |title=Detective accused in case of missing girl |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/1563383/Detective-accused-in-case-of-missing-girl.html |work=[[The Daily Telegraph]] |location=London |access-date=14 October 2017}} *{{cite news |last=Antezana |first=Fabiola |date=26 September 2007 |title=Detective in McCann Case Investigated For Beating Convicted Child Murderer |url=http://abcnews.go.com/TheLaw/story?id=3646987&page=1#.UZeqSoIilDQ |work=[[ABC News]] |location=New York City |access-date=14 October 2017}}</ref> One of the two officers who was convicted, Chief Inspector [[Disappearance of Madeleine McCann#Amaral|Gonçalo Amaral]], led the investigation into the [[disappearance of Madeleine McCann]], a [[United Kingdom|British]] girl who went missing in May 2007 from the nearby resort of [[Praia da Luz]]. Amaral was not present during the alleged assault, but was accused of having covered up for other officers; he was convicted of having falsified police documents in the case and received an eighteen-month suspended sentence.<ref name=PA22May2009>{{cite news |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=22 May 2009 |title='McCann detective guilty of perjury |url=https://www.theguardian.com/uk/feedarticle/8521559 |dead-url=y |language=English |work=[[The Guardian]] |location=London |agency=[[Press Association]] |archive-url=http://truthcannotbesilenced.blogspot.pt/2009/05/madeleine-detective-convicted-of.html |archive-date=22 October 2009 |access-date=October 14, 2017 |via=Truth be Told}}</ref>
Several similarities between the cases—both girls vanished without trace within {{convert|7|mi}} and less than three years of each other, both cases had officers who failed to secure the [[crime scene]], both mothers mounted campaigns to find their daughters and both women were accused of involvement—prompted Joana's family to [[appeal]] in 2008 for police to investigate whether there was a link between the disappearances.<ref name=Watts12May2008/>
==Disappearance and charges== {{ external media | float = right | width = 250px | image1 = [http://img.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2007/09_02/CiprinanoMOS1509_468x642.jpg Leonor Cipriano], holding a poster of her daughter. }} Joana Cipriano, eight years old at the time, was last seen at around 8 pm on the evening she disappeared, after being sent to buy milk and a tin of tuna from a local store. A neighbour saw her around 200 yards from her house, walking back from the store. Her mother, Leonor Cipriano, launched a local campaign to find her daughter, distributing posters around the neighbourhood.<ref name=Watts12May2008/>
The [[prosecution]] argued that Joana was killed because she had seen her mother and João Cipriano, her mother's brother, [[incest|having sex]]. Leonor [[confession|confessed]] to killing her daughter after nearly 48 hours of continuous interrogation. Her brother confessed to having assaulted Joana, and said he had cut her body into small pieces and placed her inside a [[refrigerator]], which was put inside an old car that was taken to [[Spain]] to be crushed and burned.<ref name=PortugalNews/> When he was asked if he had [[sexual abuse|sexually abused]] Joana, he said, "I did not harm her - I only killed her."<ref>{{cite news |last=Marques |first=Sara |date=5 September 2007 |title='Eu não lhe fiz mal, só a matei' |trans-title='I did not harm her, I only killed her' |url=http://diario.iol.pt/sociedade/joana-morte-algarve-pj-homicidio/850467-4071.html |dead-url=y |language=Portuguese |work=IOLDiário |location=Lisbon |archive-url=http://arquivo.pt/wayback/20150509005133/http://diario.iol.pt/sociedade/joana-morte-algarve-pj-homicidio/850467-4071.html |archive-date=9 May 2015 |access-date=14 October 2017 |via=Arquivo da Web Portuguesa}}</ref>
==Controversy== ===Allegations of police misconduct=== {{ external media | float = right | width = 250px |image1 = [http://img.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2007/09_02/Cipriano2MOS1509_468x648.jpg Bruising on the mother's face] after she was interviewed by police. }} Leonor retracted her confession the day after making it, claiming she had been beaten. She suffered extensive bruising to her face and body, which the police said was caused by her throwing herself down some stairs in the police station in an effort to kill herself. Five officers, including [[Gonçalo Amaral]], head of the regional ''[[Polícia Judiciária]]'' in [[Portimão]] at the time, were charged with a number of offences. The [[indictment]] alleged that several of them had kicked Leonor, hit her with a cardboard tube, put a plastic bag over her head, and made her kneel on glass ashtrays.<ref name=Watts12May2008/>
Three officers, Leonel Marques, Paulo Pereira Cristóvão and Paulo Marques Bom, were [[acquittal|acquitted]] of torture.<ref name=olive/> Amaral was not present at the time of the alleged beating but was accused of having covered up for the other officers, which he denied.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Hamilos |first1=Paul |last2=de Beer |first2=Brendan |date=3 October 2007 |title=Detective leading hunt for Madeleine sacked after blast at UK police |url=https://www.theguardian.com/uk/2007/oct/03/ukcrime.uknews4 |work=[[The Guardian]] |location=London |access-date=14 October 2017}} *{{cite news |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |title=Ex-chief of Maddy McCann case 'in cover-up' |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/1579632/Ex-chief-of-Maddy-McCann-case-in-cover-up.html |work=[[The Daily Telegraph]] |location=London |date=23 February 2008 |access-date=14 October 2017}}</ref> He was convicted of [[perjury]] in May 2009 for having falsified documents in the case, and received an eighteen-month [[suspended sentence]].<ref name=PA22May2009/> Another officer, António Nunes Cardoso, was also found guilty of having falsified documents and received a two-and-a-half year suspended sentence.<ref name=olive>{{cite news |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |title=Maddy police chief falsified evidence |url=http://www.theolivepress.es/spain-news/2009/06/02/maddy-police-chief-falsified-evidence/ |work=The Olive Press |location=San Luis de Sabinillas, Malaga, Spain |date=2 June 2009 |access-date=14 October 2017}}</ref>
===Comparison to McCann case=== The village of Figueira is only seven miles from [[Praia da Luz]], where [[Disappearance of Madeleine McCann|Madeleine McCann disappeared]] on 3 May 2007.<ref name=Watts14Sep2007>{{cite news |last=Watts |first=Alex |date=14 September 2007 |title=Girl's Case 'May Solve McCann Mystery |url=http://news.sky.com/skynews/article/0,,91210-1283987,00.html |dead-url=y |language=English |work=[[Sky News]] |location=London |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071009185533/http://news.sky.com/skynews/article/0,,91210-1283987,00.html |archive-date=9 October 2007 |access-date=14 October 2017 |via=[[Internet Archive]] [[Wayback Machine]]}}</ref> In both cases the mothers launched campaigns to find their daughters and in both cases the local ''Polícia Judiciária'' investigated the possibility that the mothers had killed their daughters.<ref name=Govan26May2007>{{cite news |last=Govan |first=Fiona |date=28 May 2007 |title=The detectives working as the world watches |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/1552718/The-detectives-working-as-the-world-watches.html |work=[[The Daily Telegraph]] |location=London |access-date=14 October 2017}} *{{cite book |last=Collins |first=Danny |date=2008 |title=Vanished: The Truth about the Disappearance of Madeleine McCann |url=https://books.google.pt/books/about/Vanished.html?id=iHhVLQAACAAJ |location= |publisher=[[John Blake (journalist)#John Blake Publishing|John Blake Publishing]] |page= |isbn=1844546144 |author-link= }} (Note: paperback edition).</ref>
A child protection specialist, [[Mark Williams-Thomas]], who believes that Joana's and Madeleine's disappearances are related, said that the disappearance of two children unknown to each other, within a period of four years in a seven-mile radius, would be a huge [[coincidence]], especially considering that Portugal is a small country with few abductions.<ref name=Watts14Sep2007/> Before Joana's disappearance, the previous [[first-degree murder]] of a child in the [[Algarve]] region was in November 1990 and involved a British girl, nine-year-old Rachel Charles, who was abducted and murdered in [[Albufeira]]. Her body was found three days later; a British mechanic and friend of the family, Michael Cook, was arrested and convicted.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Tweedie |first1=Neil |last2=Edwards |first2=Richard |date=12 May 2007 |title=Have police failed Madeleine? |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/1551346/Have-police-failed-Madeleine.html |work=[[The Daily Telegraph]] |location=London |access-date=14 October 2017 }} *On 19 June 1996 a six-year-old [[Germany|German]] child, Renè Hasèe, also disappeared, from the Amoreira beach near [[Aljezur]] while walking a few metres ahead of his parents; see [http://www.doenetwork.org/cases/2075dmprt.html The Doe Network: Case File 2075DMPRT] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080508221139/http://www.doenetwork.org/cases/2075dmprt.html |date=2008-05-08 }} and [http://en.sevenload.com/photos/Qxy8SOM-Rene-Hasee-vermisst-seit-dem-19-Juni-1996 "Rene Hasee vermisst seit dem 19.Juni 1996"]{{dead link|date=February 2018|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}.</ref> Leandro Silva, Leonor's [[Common-law marriage|common-law husband]], said in 2007 that "the only difference between the McCanns and us is that we don't have money."<ref>{{cite news |last=Antezana |first=Fabiola |date=26 September 2007 |title=Detective in McCann Case Investigated For Beating Convicted Child Murderer |url=http://abcnews.go.com/TheLaw/story?id=3646987&page=1#.UZeqSoIilDQ |work=[[ABC News]] |location=New York City |access-date=14 October 2017}}</ref>
==See also== {{portal|Criminal justice|Death|Portugal}} *[[Crime in Portugal]] *[[List of murder convictions without a body]] *[[List of people who disappeared mysteriously]] {{-}}
==Notes== {{reflist|2}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Cipriano, Joana}} [[Category:2004 crimes in Portugal]] [[Category:2000s missing person cases]] [[Category:Algarve]] [[Category:Crime in Portugal]] [[Category:Deaths by person]] [[Category:Murdered Portuguese children]] [[Category:Murder in 2004]] [[Category:Murder in Portugal]] [[Category:Murder convictions without a body]]

'''Johnathon Robert Madden''' (11 May 1991 – 25 November 2003) was a twelve-year-old [[Canada|Canadian]] boy whose gruesome [[murder]] at the hands of his sixteen-year-old brother Kevin Madden and his brother's friend Timothy Ferriman provoked widespread revulsion and outrage in Johnathon's home city of [[Toronto]] and across Canada.
The ensuing trials of Madden and Ferriman have created a media sensation in Toronto and in the Canadian English media generally, which intensified after the first trial ended in a mistrial when a key [[witness]] was discovered to have committed [[perjury]].
Madden and Ferriman were convicted, respectively, of first-degree murder and [[manslaughter]] in early 2006, but until September 29, 2006, when Justice David McCombs elected to sentence the youths as adults, the names of the principals in the case were precluded from publication by provisions of Canada's [[Youth Criminal Justice Act]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/servlet/story/RTGAM.20060930.wxjohnathon30/BNStory/National/home|title=This was Johnathon|publisher=Globe and Mail|date=September 30, 2006|accessdate=2006-09-30}}</ref>
== Death == On the afternoon of November 25, Kevin Madden (then 16) was at home, accompanied by Timothy Ferriman and another friend, who remains publicly unidentified. The three began to extensively [[vandalism|vandalize]] the family home, smashing beer bottles and a television with baseball bats, while drinking wine. Less than an hour before attacking Johnathon, all three spoke on the telephone to Ferriman's girlfriend indicating that a mass murder would occur; she tape-recorded this conversation.
Shortly thereafter, Kevin Madden attacked Johnathon with a [[butcher knife]], cutting his face and neck 71 times, and severing his [[larynx|voice box]] and his [[carotid artery]]. Though present, Ferriman did not stab Johnathon himself but encouraged Kevin and handed him the knife, and afterwards helped to move Johnathon's body.
Following Johnathon's death, the boys hid his body in a basement crawl space. Together, the three awaited the arrival of Kevin's and Johnathon's stepfather, Ralston Champagnie, coming home from work. Upon Champagnie's arrival, he was attacked with a baseball bat and knife, but managed to escape from the house.
Johnathon's body was retrieved later that evening. All three boys were arrested within 24 hours of the incident.
== First court case == The first court case relied on Ferriman's girlfriend as the Crown's key witness. It ended in a [[mistrial (law)|mistrial]] after she apparently [[perjury|perjured]] herself.
She made several posts on the site [[vampirefreaks.com]] indicating an interest in [[vampirism]], which contradicted earlier court testimony.
== Second court case == During the second case, Kevin Madden stated that "people who did not know Johnathon should not be concerned about what happened to him" <ref>{{cite web| url=http://torontosun.com/News/TorontoAndGTA/2006/09/30/1924478-sun.html| title=Murderer 'a deeply disturbed young man'|publisher=Toronto Sun|date=September 30, 2006|accessdate=2006-09-30}}</ref>
The verdict for the second court case was delivered on 27 February 2006. The jury determined that Kevin Madden was guilty of first-degree murder for his role in Johnathon's death, and guilty of attempted murder for his attack on his stepfather, Champagnie. Ferriman was found guilty of manslaughter for assisting in Johnathon's death. The third boy, who remains unidentified, was acquitted.<ref>{{cite web| url=https://www.thestar.com/NASApp/cs/ContentServer?pagename=thestar/Layout/Article_Type1&c=Article&cid=1159523528068&call_pageid=968332188492&col=968793972154&t=TS_Home| title=Johnathon's killers jailed|publisher=Toronto Star|date=September 30, 2006|accessdate=2006-09-30}}</ref>
In the sentencing hearing on 29 September 2006, Justice David McCombs determined that Madden and Ferriman should be sentenced as adults, which permitted their identities, and those of the rest of Madden's family, to be published for the first time.
Both Madden's and Ferriman's lawyers indicated they were displeased with that their clients were not sentenced as youths. Speaking of Madden, who had expressed no remorse or emotion in response to his actions throughout the trials, his lawyer said "Kevin desperately needs treatment, and unfortunately he's not going to get it. We could have had 10 years of in-depth treatment in the youth system and he's not going to get it." <ref>{{cite web| url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/servlet/story/RTGAM.20060929.wjohnathan0929/BNStory/National/home| title=Two teens sentenced as adults in Johnathon killing|publisher=Globe and Mail|date=September 29, 2006|accessdate=2006-09-30}}</ref> Ferriman's lawyer indicated he would appeal the decision, while Madden's lawyer said he was considering it.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://www.canada.com/topics/news/national/story.html?id=8050a224-47c4-433b-b1ed-48a057cc436d&k=3314|title=Mother weeps as oldest son handed life sentence for stabbing death of her youngest|publisher=Canada.com|date=September 30, 2006|accessdate=2006-09-30}}</ref>
In the sentencing hearing, Ferriman addressed the court and apologized for what he had done. His remorse enabled his sentence to be served in a youth facility.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://www.cbc.ca/canada/toronto/story/2006/09/29/johnathan-sentence.html| title='Johnathan' named as teen killers receive adult sentences|publisher=CBC News|date=September 30, 2006|accessdate=2006-09-30}}</ref>
== Aftermath == Following the release of information after the [[publication ban]] was lifted, Joanne Champagnie, mother of Johnathon and Kevin Madden, launched a website dedicated to Johnathon's memory.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://www.torontosun.com/News/TorontoAndGTA/2006/09/30/1924477-sun.html| title=A blue-eyed boy with a timid grin|publisher=Toronto Sun|date=September 30, 2006|accessdate=2006-09-30 |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20061022185149/http://www.torontosun.com/News/TorontoAndGTA/2006/09/30/1924477-sun.html <!-- Bot retrieved archive --> |archivedate = 2006-10-22}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== *[http://www.johnathon-madden.memory-of.com Memorial website for Johnathon Madden] created by Joanne Champagnie

page.title: My Love, Don't Cross That River

revision.text:
{{Infobox film | name = My Love, Don't Cross That River | image = My_Love,_Don't_Cross_That_River.jpg | caption = Theatrical poster | director = [[Jin Mo-young]] | producer = Han Gyeong-su | starring = Jo Byeong-man
Kang Kye-yeol | cinematography = Jin Mo-young | music = Jeong Min-woo | editing = Hyun Jin-sik | distributor = CGV Art House
Daemyung Culture Factory | studio = Argus Film | country = South Korea | language = Korean | runtime = 85 minutes | budget = {{USD|110,000}} | gross = {{USD|34.3 million}}{{cite web | url = https://variety.com/2015/film/news/korea-box-office-ode-and-love-forecast-top-chart-sniper-opens-in-eighth-1201408533/ | title = Korea Box Office: ''Ode'' and ''Love Forecast'' top Chart, ''Sniper'' Opens in Eighth | first = Sonia | last = Kil | website = [[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] | date = 18 January 2015 | accessdate = 19 January 2015}} | released = {{Film date|2013|11||[[DMZ International Documentary Film Festival|DMZ Docs]]|2014|11|27|South Korea}} }} '''''My Love, Don't Cross That River''''' ({{ko-hhrm|님아, 그 강을 건너지 마오}}) is a [[List of South Korean films of 2013|2013 South Korean]] [[documentary film]] that follows elderly married couple Jo Byeong-man and Kang Kye-yeol until the last moments of their 76-year marriage.{{cite web|last1=Conran|first1=Pierce|title=My Love, Don't Cross that River|url=http://koreanfilm.or.kr/webzine/sub/newfilms.jsp?mode=A_VIEW&wbSeq=179|website=Korean Cinema Today|accessdate=12 December 2014|date=24 November 2014}} Documentary filmmaker [[Jin Mo-young]] filmed Jo and Kang in the couple's mountain village in [[Hoengseong County]], [[Gangwon Province (South Korea)|Gangwon Province]] for 15 months.{{cite web|last1=Lee|first1=Sook-myung|title=JIN Mo-young, Director of ''MY LOVE, DON'T CROSS THAT RIVER'': "There's no need to be caught up in film scores"|url=http://www.koreanfilm.or.kr/jsp/news/interview.jsp?mode=INTERVIEW_VIEW&seq=140&blbdComCd=601019|website=Korean Film Biz Zone|accessdate=3 May 2015|date=5 January 2015}} ''My Love, Don't Cross That River'' premiered at the 2013 [[DMZ International Documentary Film Festival]], where it won the Audience Award. It was released in theaters on 27 November 2014 and through [[word of mouth]] became the most commercially successful Korean documentary/[[independent film]] of all time.{{cite web|last1=Yim|first1=Ju-ri|last2=Go|first2=Seok-hee|title=Film on elderly couple a surprise hit|url=http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/Article.aspx?aid=2998634|website=[[Korea JoongAng Daily]]|accessdate=27 December 2014|date=18 December 2014}}{{cite web|title=Indie Documentary Breaks Box-Office Records|url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2014/12/26/2014122601464.html|website=[[The Chosun Ilbo]]|accessdate=27 December 2014|date=26 December 2014}} == Production == Married couple, 95-year-old Jo Byeong-man and 90-year-old Kang Kye-yeol, were first featured onscreen in a five-episode segment titled ''Gray-haired Lovers'' on a [[Korean Broadcasting System|KBS]] [[television documentary]] program that aired in 2011.{{cite web|last=|first=|title=REEL Talk: Golden Year for Korean Documentaries|url=http://www.arirang.co.kr/News/News_View.asp?nseq=172490|website=[[Arirang (TV network)|Arirang News]]|accessdate=11 December 2014|date=4 December 2014}} After documentary filmmaker Jin Mo-young saw Jo and Kang on TV, he rushed to the couple's mountain village in [[Hoengseong County]], [[Gangwon Province (South Korea)|Gangwon Province]] and asked them if he could make their story into a possible film. After obtaining their permission in September 2012, Jin followed the couple for 15 months and documented their everyday life.{{cite web|url=https://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/culture/2014/12/141_169856.html|title=Korean docu film tops box office, beats ''Interstellar'', ''Exodus''|last=Baek|first=Byung-yeul|website=[[The Korea Times]]|date=14 December 2014|accessdate=18 December 2014}}{{cite web|last1=Ahn|first1=Sung-mi|title=Gray-haired lovers become cinema hit|url=http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20141215000900|website=[[The Korea Herald]]|accessdate=15 December 2014|date=15 December 2014}} == Reception == Upon its theatrical release on 27 November 2014, the film became the most commercially successful Korean independent film of all time in terms of revenue and attendance.{{cite web|title=Indie Documentary on Track to Set New Record|url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2014/12/09/2014120901510.html|website=[[The Chosun Ilbo]]|accessdate=11 December 2014|date=8 December 2014}}{{cite web|last1=Conran|first1=Pierce|title=Korean Doc Becomes Top Indie of the Year|url=http://www.koreanfilm.or.kr/jsp/news/news.jsp?mode=VIEW&seq=3256|website=Korean Film Biz Zone|accessdate=12 December 2014|date=10 December 2014}}{{cite web|last1=Sung|first1=So-young|title=Documentary tops box office|url=http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/Article.aspx?aid=2998454|website=[[Korea JoongAng Daily]]|accessdate=15 December 2014|date=13 December 2014}}{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2014/12/my-love-dont-cross-that-river-record-documentary-south-korea-box-office-1201324795/|title=He's 98, She's 89 And Their Love Story Is Edging Hollywood At Korea's B.O.|first=Nancy|last=Tartaglione|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|date=14 December 2014|accessdate=15 December 2014}} === Box office === In South Korea, the film topped the box office during its opening weekend with {{SK won|5.13 billion}} ({{USD|4.66 million}}) ahead of its competition, Hollywood films ''[[Interstellar (film)|Interstellar]]'', ''[[Exodus: Gods and Kings]]'' and ''[[The Theory of Everything (2014 film)|The Theory of Everything]]''. It was the second time ever and the first time in five years that a documentary film had topped the Korean box office since ''[[Old Partner]]'' opened at No. 1 in 2009. It has so far grossed {{SK won|8.38 billion}} ({{USD|7.62 million}}) in 15 days, which is 70 times its production budget of {{SK won|120 million}} ({{USD|110,000}}).{{cite web|last1=Kim|first1=Nemo|title=Korea Box Office: Local Documentary Tops Weekend Chart|url=https://variety.com/2014/film/news/korea-box-office-local-documentary-tops-weekend-chart-1201379548/|website=[[Variety (magazine)|''Variety'']]|accessdate=15 December 2014|date=15 December 2014}}{{cite web|last1=Jin|first1=Eun-soo|title=Domestic documentary gains a box office record|url=http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/Article.aspx?aid=2998541|website=[[Korea JoongAng Daily]]|accessdate=27 December 2014|date=16 December 2014}} As of January 2015, the film drew 3.73 million admissions, beating ''Old Partner'''s record (2.93 million) to become the highest grossing Korean independent/documentary film of all time.{{cite web | url = https://variety.com/2015/film/news/berlin-demographics-technology-favor-the-revival-of-indie-films-1201425676/ | title = Berlin: Demographics, Technology Favor the Revival of South Korean Indie Films | author = Sonia Kil | publisher = ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' | date =6 February 2015 | accessdate =14 February 2015}} === Critical reception === ''My Love, Don't Cross That River'' has received mostly positive reviews from critics. [[Review aggregator]] [[Rotten Tomatoes]] gives the film an approval rating of 84%, based on 25 reviews, with an average rating of 6.5/10.{{cite web |url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/my_love_dont_cross_that_river/|title=''My Love, Don't Cross That River'' (2016)|website=[[Rotten Tomatoes]]|accessdate=15 February 2018}} On [[Metacritic]], the film has a score of 68 out of 100, based on 8 critics, indicating "generally favorable reviews".{{cite web |url=http://www.metacritic.com/movie/my-love-dont-cross-that-river|title=''My Love, Don't Cross That River'' reviews|website=Metacritic |accessdate=25 August 2016}} Frank Scheck of ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'' gave a positive review calling it "the cinematic equivalent of marriage counseling."{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/review/my-love-dont-cross-river-903078|title='My Love, Don't Cross That River': Film Review|author=Frank Scheck|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=15 June 2016|accessdate=15 June 2016}} === Film festivals === Aside from DMZ Docs, the film was also invited to screen at the [[Moscow International Film Festival]], [[Hot Docs Canadian International Documentary Festival]], the [[Sydney Film Festival]], and the [[Los Angeles Film Festival]] in 2015.{{cite web|last1=Kim|first1=June|title=Hot Docs Picks ''MY LOVE, DON'T CROSS THAT RIVER''|url=http://www.koreanfilm.or.kr/jsp/news/news.jsp?mode=VIEW&seq=3370|website=Korean Film Biz Zone|accessdate=3 May 2015|date=18 March 2015}}{{cite web|last1=Kim|first1=June|title=''MY LOVE, DON'T CROSS THAT RIVER'' Invited to Sydney|url=http://www.koreanfilm.or.kr/jsp/news/news.jsp?mode=VIEW&seq=3402|website=Korean Film Biz Zone|accessdate=3 May 2015|date=16 April 2015}} === Awards and nominations === {| class="wikitable" |- ! Year ! Award ! Category ! Recipient ! Result |- | 2014 |

Korean director wins top documentary award in LA film fest|url=http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20150619000262|website=[[The Korea Herald]]|accessdate=21 June 2015|date=19 June 2015}}{{cite web|last1=Jin|first1=Eun-soo|title=''My Love'' wins prize in L.A.|url=http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/Article.aspx?aid=3005620|website=[[Korea JoongAng Daily]]|accessdate=21 June 2015|date=20 June 2015}}
| Documentary Award | ''My Love, Don't Cross That River'' | {{won}} |} ==References== {{reflist|2}} == External links == * [http://www.kmdb.or.kr/eng/vod/vod_basic.asp?nation=A&p_dataid=06213 ''My Love, Don't Cross That River''] at the [[Korean Movie Database]] * {{IMDb title|4063314}} * {{hancinema film|My_Love_v__Don__t_Cross_That_River}} {{DEFAULTSORT:My Love, Don't Cross That River}} [[Category:2013 films]] [[Category:Korean-language films]] [[Category:South Korean documentary films]] [[Category:South Korean films]] [[Category:Documentary films about old age]] [[Category:Documentary films about death]] [[Category:2010s documentary films]] [[Category:Films set in Gangwon]] [[Category:CGV Arthouse films]]

The '''National Campus Climate Survey (NCCS)''' is a service offered to institutions of [[higher education]] in the [[United States]] who would like to better understand and improve their campus climate with regards to [[sexual assault]] and related topics. The study is designed to: # Meet all state and federal requirements for the conduct of sexual assault [[Survey methodology|survey]]s. # Provide a scientifically rigorous survey instrument to help schools learn about the campus climate concerning [[sexual misconduct]]. # Provide varying survey implementation tiers to match institutions’ varying needs for defensible data. # Provide a benchmarking tool to allow institutions to compare their results against other participating institutions, and where possible, peer groups. The National Campus Climate Survey{{cite web|last1=Schlissel|first1=Mark|title=U-M 2015 Campus Climate Surveys Regarding Sexual Misconduct|url=https://publicaffairs.vpcomm.umich.edu/key-issues/faq-on-2015-campus-climate-surveys-regarding-sexual-misconduct/|website=U-M Public Affairs & Internal Communications|publisher=University of Michigan|accessdate=3 September 2015}} was developed at the [[University of Michigan]] in collaboration with a local survey research firm, SoundRocket (formerly known as Survey Sciences Group, LLC){{cite web|title=SoundRocket: A name is selected|url=http://www.soundrocket.com/soundrocket-blog/2015/7/21/our-story-part-5|website=SoundRocket|publisher=The Launch Pad Blog|accessdate=3 September 2015}} The study was developed in response to the report from the [[White House Task Force to Protect Students from Sexual Assault]]. == The National Campus Climate Survey == === Study Website & Enrollment === The National Campus Climate Survey launched its service and website ([http://www.nationalcampusclimatesurvey.com www.nationalcampusclimatesurvey.com]) on September 1, 2015 and is currently enrolling institutions of higher education into the Spring 2016 data collection.{{cite web|title=Sexual Assault Survey Now Available for Multi-Institutional Enrollment|url=http://www.nationalcampusclimatesurvey.org/news/2015/9/2/sexual-assault-survey-now-available-for-multi-institutional-enrollment|website=National Campus Climate Survey|accessdate=3 September 2015}} === Study Design === The core NCCS design uses a sample survey approach rather than a [[census]] of all students. (However, schools will have the option to conduct a census if they wish.) A randomly selected sample of students (undergraduates and graduates) allows the study to make scientifically based inferences to the population as a whole, helps focus finite research resources on successfully contacting and encouraging the participation of the broadest group of students, and reduces survey burden on an often over-surveyed population. The NCCS will request sample data from university registrars (i.e. gender, race/ethnicity, year in school, on/off campus residence) in addition to contact information to allow for nonresponse analyses to be conducted. If deemed appropriate, the NCCS may generate nonresponse bias weights for the final analytic data file. The NCCS will be implemented as a web-based, mobile-optimized survey, to ensure the data collected is of highest quality. Logical branching and filters will be used to tailor the questionnaire appropriately for each individual. Data collection will include at least four email contacts, and may include mailed prenotification letters, telephone calls, and in-person visits (depending on the service level selected). Data will be collected between January and April, 2016. === Service Levels === The NCCS has a three-tiered service structure, designed to meet the specific needs of the local campus. {| class="wikitable" |- ! !! Tier 1:
Campus Climate Pro !! Tier 2:
Campus Climate Pro Methods !! Tier 3:
Campus Climate Pro Comprehensive |- | '''Response Rate Goal''' || Up to 30% || 10-20% higher than Tier 1 || Achieved 67% at U-M Spring 2015{{cite web|title=Results of 2015 University of Michigan Campus Climate Survey on Sexual Misconduct|url=https://publicaffairs.vpcomm.umich.edu/wp-content/uploads/sites/19/2015/04/Complete-survey-results.pdf|website=U-M Public Affairs & Internal Communications|publisher=University of Michigan|accessdate=3 September 2015}} |- | '''Scientific Sample Size''' || n=4,000 || n=3,000 || n=2,000 |} More specifics regarding the Tier services are available on the [http://www.nationalcampusclimatesurvey.org/service-levels/ study website service levels page]. === Survey Instrument === The survey instrument and methodology were designed by a team, led by the University of Michigan’s Survey Research Center and including representatives from Student Life at the University of Michigan, the Office of the General Counsel at the University of Michigan, and SoundRocket. The team designed the survey measurements to include both the prevalence and incidence of sexual assault on campus, as well as perceptions of campus climate. The methodological team drew heavily upon behavioral-specific questions from the Sexual Experiences Survey to measure the prevalence and incidence of sexual assault, because such questions have been researched and validated. (1) The design features of this survey have demonstrated effectiveness in minimizing response errors in web surveys, as well as minimizing overall respondent burden. (2) The average length for completion of the survey instrument is less than 15 minutes. An early draft of the survey instrument is available at the [https://publicaffairs.vpcomm.umich.edu/wp-content/uploads/sites/19/2015/04/Campus-climate-survey-questions.pdf University of Michigan 2015 Campus Climate Surveys Regarding Sexual Misconduct] page. == References == {{Reflist|2}} [[Category:Sexual violence]] [[Category:Sex crimes in the United States]] [[Category:Universities and colleges in the United States]] [[Category:Surveys]]
